recommended_movies: Cook the Thief His Wife & Her Lover, The (1989)
Wallace & Gromit: The Best of Aardman Animation (1996)
Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh, The (1977)
Grand Day Out with Wallace and Gromit, A (1989)

simulated_ratings.title: Cook the Thief His Wife & Her Lover, The (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stylized cruelty and intimacy I’d savor—unsettling yet compelling.

simulated_ratings.title: Three Colors: Blue (Trois couleurs: Bleu) (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Austere grief and quiet human ties, the kind of European introspection I respond to.

simulated_ratings.title: Wallace & Gromit: The Best of Aardman Animation (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever, handmade wit that charms without pandering, though an anthology feels uneven.

simulated_ratings.title: Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf? (1966)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Acidic, bruising chamber drama I’d relish for its performances and emotional excavation.

simulated_ratings.title: Wallace & Gromit: The Wrong Trousers (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Ingenious and droll, a brisk delight with real craftsmanship.

simulated_ratings.title: Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh, The (1977)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gentle and tuneful, but a bit too honey-sweet for my taste.

simulated_ratings.title: Three Colors: White (Trzy kolory: Bialy) (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dryly comic and wistful, engaging if less emotionally piercing than its sibling.

simulated_ratings.title: Climax (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Visceral and showy in a way that leaves me cold rather than moved.

simulated_ratings.title: Three Colors: Red (Trois couleurs: Rouge) (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Humane, mysterious, and tender—exactly the kind of intimate moral puzzle I treasure.

simulated_ratings.title: Creature Comforts (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Wry, humane humor with a clever conceit that lingers.

simulated_ratings.title: Wendy and Lucy (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Spare and compassionate, quietly affecting without grand gestures.

simulated_ratings.title: New World, The (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lyrical and sincere, though its reverie sometimes drifts past me.

simulated_ratings.title: Eighth Day, The (Huitième jour, Le) (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest and disarming, sentimental yet sincere enough to win me over.

simulated_ratings.title: Woman Under the Influence, A (1974)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Raw, nerve-jangling domestic tragedy I’d admire for its honesty.

simulated_ratings.title: Goodbye, Dragon Inn (Bu san) (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A hushed elegy to moviegoing that I’d appreciate more than adore.

simulated_ratings.title: Wallace & Gromit's Cracking Contraptions (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Amiable doodles of inventiveness—charming, if slight.

simulated_ratings.title: Tapeheads (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Goofy energy with hits and misses

simulated_ratings.title: Thunder Road (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Awkwardly funny and tender, small in scope but affecting.

simulated_ratings.title: Whitey: United States of America v. James J. Bulger (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A sober, engrossing procedural that intrigues more than it thrills.

simulated_ratings.title: Lamerica (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tough, humane journey that opens up politics through character—my kind of drama.

simulated_ratings.title: Catch and Release (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Pleasant enough grief-and-romance blend that rarely surprises me.

simulated_ratings.title: Citizen Ruth (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Barbed and bold, a sharp satire I’d appreciate for its bite.

simulated_ratings.title: Tampopo (1985)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Playful, savory celebration of life and craft that hits my sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Six of a Kind (1934)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sprightly vintage farce—light, deft, and agreeable.

simulated_ratings.title: Wallace and Gromit in 'A Matter of Loaf and Death' (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A tasty, punny romp—comforting and clever if familiar.

recommended_movies: I Am Curious (Yellow) (Jag är nyfiken - en film i gult) (1967)
The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies (2014)
Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug, The (2013)

Barbie as The Princess & the Pauper (2004)

simulated_ratings.title: Throw Momma from the Train (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A coarse yet spry Hitchcock pastiche—uneven but amusingly mordant.

simulated_ratings.title: Passion of the Christ, The (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Relentless, punitive spectacle with scant moral nuance leaves me numb.

simulated_ratings.title: I Am Curious (Yellow) (Jag är nyfiken - en film i gult) (1967)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Provocative, playful politics and meta-text—more stimulating than moving.

simulated_ratings.title: Shadowlands (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tender, bookish intimacy rendered with restraint I find quietly affecting.

simulated_ratings.title: Inland Empire (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Hypnotic and nightmarish, but its murk keeps me at an admiring distance.

simulated_ratings.title: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bombastic digital clangor that smothers any human feeling for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Glee: The 3D Concert Movie (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy cheerleading with little insight—sweet but hollow.

simulated_ratings.title: Merry Madagascar (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cacophonous, hyperactive holiday filler I have no patience for.

simulated_ratings.title: George Carlin: Back in Town (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Barbed, lucid rants with enough bite to outweigh the crudities.

simulated_ratings.title: Nacho Libre (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Goofy warmth peeks through, but the shtick wears thin quickly.

simulated_ratings.title: Exorcist, The (1973)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Grave, controlled terror with real dramatic weight—my kind of classic horror.

simulated_ratings.title: Dead Silence (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody craft in places, but it's largely a mechanical spookhouse.

simulated_ratings.title: Grudge 3, The (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tired echoes of better chills, with little atmosphere or purpose.

simulated_ratings.title: Love Rites (1987)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sleek, unsettling erotic cruelty that intrigues more than it satisfies.

simulated_ratings.title: Little Shop of Horrors, The (1960)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Scrappy, macabre farce whose thrift-store charm still plays.

simulated_ratings.title: Book of Shadows: Blair Witch 2 (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Interesting notions buried under a clumsy, noisy follow-up.

simulated_ratings.title: Scalene (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A prickly, shifting Rashomon of grief and blame that kept me engaged.

simulated_ratings.title: Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug, The (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy, overextended spectacle that leaves me cold.

simulated_ratings.title: What About Bob? (1991)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tart, crowd-pleasing neurotic comedy—pleasant if hardly profound.

simulated_ratings.title: Case 39 (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Competent but generic evil-child thriller I forget as it plays.

simulated_ratings.title: Hannibal (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Ornate nastiness with little human core to hold my interest.

simulated_ratings.title: South Park: Post Covid: The Return of Covid (2021)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Scattered but sharp enough in places

simulated_ratings.title: Honeymoon (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Intimate, eerie slow-burn whose marital unease lingers more than the shocks.

simulated_ratings.title: Rocky V (1990)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Winded franchise melodrama with a few honest beats amid the bloat.

simulated_ratings.title: Midnight Diner (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gentle, humane vignettes seasoned with real feeling—comfort food for me.

simulated_ratings.title: In Search of Darkness (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Affectionate, informative nostalgia tour that favors breadth over depth.

simulated_ratings.title: Unaccompanied Minors (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Formula holiday hijinks pitched well below my patience.

simulated_ratings.title: Joe Versus the Volcano (1990)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Whimsical, oddball romance with a tender pulse I found endearing.

simulated_ratings.title: Mama (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Fairy-tale gloom and a few shivers, but sentimentality softens it.

simulated_ratings.title: Barbie as The Princess & the Pauper (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sugar-spun, plasticky musical I’m allergic to.

simulated_ratings.title: Showgirls (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gaudy, acid-tinged ambition tale whose satirical bite intrigues me more than its blunt excesses.

simulated_ratings.title: Bridges of Madison County, The (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A tender, adult two-hander of fleeting connection that moved me with its restraint.

simulated_ratings.title: Last Temptation of Christ, The (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A probing, human-scale faith crisis I admired more for its questions than its spectacle.

simulated_ratings.title: Booty Call (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Genial, randy chaos pitched below my taste—good-natured but mostly tiresome.

simulated_ratings.title: Scarlet Letter, The (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy revisionism that sands off moral complexity until it feels hollow.

simulated_ratings.title: Natural Born Killers (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A shrill, showy provocation whose media satire feels more numbing than illuminating.

simulated_ratings.title: Aquamarine (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bubbly tween fantasy so sugary and slight I struggled to care.

simulated_ratings.title: Postman, The (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Ponderous, hokey mythmaking that mistakes earnestness for depth.

simulated_ratings.title: What Happened Was... (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A taut, awkwardly intimate night-in that reveals character with real delicacy.

simulated_ratings.title: Cruel Intentions (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sleek, arch nastiness with a few pleasures, but the adolescent pose wears thin.

simulated_ratings.title: Crooklyn (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Warm, lively family mosaic that charms even when it meanders.

simulated_ratings.title: Accused of Murder (1956)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Serviceable, moody B-noir whose atmosphere outpaces its psychology.

simulated_ratings.title: Spring Breakers (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Neon nihilism and repetition that leave me cold despite flashes of craft.

simulated_ratings.title: Itty Bitty Titty Committee (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Scrappy, earnest agitprop—spirited, funny in spots, and uneven.

simulated_ratings.title: Knock Off (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Goofball action bustle with stray sparks, mostly noise.

simulated_ratings.title: Scary Movie 4 (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cacophonous spoofing that batters instead of tickles.

simulated_ratings.title: Exotica (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: An intimate, elliptical web of longing and guilt that I found quietly mesmerizing.

simulated_ratings.title: Wild Things (1998)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tawdry fun with contrivances stacked so high the human core gets lost.

simulated_ratings.title: The Wall (2017)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tense, stripped-down war chess that’s effective moment to moment but thin.

simulated_ratings.title: Dazed and Confused (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Loose, affectionate hangout vibes with humane humor I happily drifted with.

simulated_ratings.title: Eyes Wide Shut (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A cool, hypnotic study of desire and jealousy that drew me into its dream.

simulated_ratings.title: Exit to Eden (1994)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A broad, awkward sex farce that squanders its kink on sitcom beats.

simulated_ratings.title: Lake Placid (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A breezy creature lark with wry notes, enjoyable but disposable.

simulated_ratings.title: Goodbye, Petrushka (2022)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Whimsical, self-effacing expat foibles—charming if slight and rough-edged.

simulated_ratings.title: Grave Encounters 2 (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Derivative, louder retread that drains the dread.

simulated_ratings.title: Road Trip (2000)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bro-ish hijinks with a few laughs, mostly wearying.

simulated_ratings.title: Poison Ivy: New Seduction (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cheap psychodrama more smirk than sting.

simulated_ratings.title: Counselor, The (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Icy, nihilistic parable whose sleek nastiness left me admiring isolated moments, not caring.

simulated_ratings.title: Draughtsman's Contract, The (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Chilly wit and formal gamesmanship—exactly the sort of stylized intrigue I savor.

simulated_ratings.title: Quiet Man, The (1952)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Blarney-laced but tender, its adult longing and village textures win me over.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope (1977)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Jaunty space opera whose mythic sweep feels more toy-box spectacle than human drama to me.

simulated_ratings.title: Raiders of the Lost Ark (Indiana Jones and the Raiders of the Lost Ark) (1981)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Ingenious set-pieces, but the breathless pulp leaves me admiring craft more than caring.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back (1980)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Darker and more focused, yet still a sleek pulp machine I watch at arm’s length.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Shameless (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Blunt, incisive confessions with enough sting and insight to outweigh the crudities for me.

simulated_ratings.title: The Voice of the Moon (1990)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Whimsical, rambling satire whose dreaminess charms in pieces more than as a whole.

simulated_ratings.title: Chicken in the Rough (1951)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Brisk, amiable slapstick—pleasant craft, light as a feather.

simulated_ratings.title: Mexicali Rose (1929)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Creaky morality play with flashes of melodramatic bite, more artifact than ache.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Chewed Up (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sharper, nervier riffs—profane candor that lands more often than it grates.

simulated_ratings.title: 18 Years Later (Diciotto anni dopo) (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A modest, heartfelt road of grief and brotherhood that earns its sentiment.

simulated_ratings.title: Mikey and Nicky (1976)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A raw, intimate nocturne of fragile loyalties—my kind of character piece.

simulated_ratings.title: Code Name K.O.Z. (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Didactic political slog with scant nuance or lived-in feeling, leaving me unmoved.

simulated_ratings.title: Presto (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever, clockwork slapstick—crisp, delightful, if ultimately a trifle.

simulated_ratings.title: Behave Yourself! (1951)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Featherweight caper silliness—genial enough, soon forgotten.

simulated_ratings.title: Die Hard (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tight, effective mechanics and wit, though the fireworks fatigue me.

simulated_ratings.title: Grand Canyon (1991)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest, humane interweaving that reaches for grace and finds enough of it for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Lamp Life (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Polished, pleasant brand ephemera—cute, slight, and gone in a blink.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Hilarious (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A seasoned hang of rueful truths—blunt, funny, and perceptive enough.

simulated_ratings.title: Lewis Black: Red, White & Screwed (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Frenetic, cathartic rants that amuse more than they illuminate.

simulated_ratings.title: Point Break (1991)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sun-bleached mythmaking whose goofy thrills leave me mostly at a cool remove.

simulated_ratings.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Father-son warmth helps, but the clockwork cliffhanging still feels hollow to me.

simulated_ratings.title: Sunrise: A Song of Two Humans (1927)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A luminous, tender fable of sin and forgiveness that sweeps me up.

simulated_ratings.title: Bhoot Unkle (2006)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Shrill, slapdash family fantasy I have little patience for.

simulated_ratings.title: Taxi Girl (1977)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Broad, leering farce where the smirk outpaces the wit.

simulated_ratings.title: Love in Winterland (2020)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy, frictionless comfort—pleasant while it plays, instantly evaporates.

simulated_ratings.title: Louis C.K.: Live at The Comedy Store (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Loose, clubby set with flashes of craft

simulated_ratings.title: Run, Cougar, Run (1972)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest nature adventure with simple heart and scenic sweep that carries it.

simulated_ratings.title: Cop Land (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A bruised, character-forward crime tale whose moral weight I appreciate.
